title: Adelaide school worker charged with child sex offences, indecent assault
text:
An Adelaide school worker has been charged with child sex offences.

Despite being arrested at the weekend, the Education Department only today revealed charges had been laid against the “metropolitan school employee”.

The Department refused to say if the man, 52, was a teacher.

Authorities also refused to say if the aggravated indecent assault charges were linked to a student.

Parents have been advised, a spokesman added, and the worker suspended.

It remains unclear if he is being paid while suspended. Hills and Fleurieu CIB detectives are investigating.

A police statement, published on the weekend, said the man was Adelaide Hills based.

“As a result of an ongoing investigation detectives arrested a 52-year-old man on Sunday,” a police spokesman said.

“He was charged with aggravated indecent assault and possess child exploitation material.”

The man, who cannot be identified currently under state law, was bailed to appear in the Mt Barker Magistrates Court in December.

An Education Department spokesman said: “We have been advised that a metropolitan school employee has been arrested and charged with child sexual offences.

“The employee has been directed away from the workplace.

“The school is being provided with appropriate support.”

He said a letter had been sent to the school community, in accordance with Debelle protocols.

Former Supreme Court Justice Bruce Debelle’s Royal Commission inquiry recommended that parents be told about any such charges.
description: A 52-year-old Adelaide school worker has been charged with child sex offences and suspended from duties.
